title: Job Openings at GUO Transport Company
content:
GUO Transport Company is a division of G. U. Okeke & Sons Ltd. A household name in the transportation industry and one of the largest providers of intercity and interstate transportation, serving more than 200 destinations across Nigeria and West Africa with a modern and environmentally friendly fleet.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Automobile Maintenance Supervisor

Job Location: Ogbunike - Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, technicians, and support staff in the automobile maintenance workshop.
	Plan, schedule, and monitor preventive and corrective maintenance of all company vehicles (buses, trucks, cars, etc.)
	Inspect vehicles to identify mechanical issues and ensure timely resolution.
	Ensure all maintenance and repair activities comply with safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate records of vehicle maintenance history, repairs, and spare parts usage.
	Monitor workshop inventory, requisition spare parts, and ensure proper usage to minimize wastage.
	Prepare periodic reports on fleet condition, maintenance costs, and downtime.
	Train and guide mechanics/technicians to improve skill levels and efficiency.
	Collaborate with fleet operations to minimize vehicle downtime and ensure availability for business needs.
	Enforce compliance with company policies, health, and safety guidelines in the workshop.
	Recommend improvements in maintenance processes and cost-control measures.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Click here to apply online

 

 

 

2.) Transport Operations Personnel

Job Location: Maza-Maza, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Assist in planning and coordinating daily vehicle schedules, routes, and assignments.
	Monitor vehicle movements to ensure timely departures, arrivals, and adherence to schedules.
	Maintain accurate records of trips, drivers, waybills, and delivery documentation.
	Liaise with drivers, loaders, and station staff to resolve operational issues promptly.
	Ensure compliance with transport policies, safety regulations, and company procedures.
	Support in monitoring fuel usage, mileage, and other operational costs.
	Report incidents, delays, and breakdowns to the supervisor/manager for immediate action
	Assist in coordinating routine inspections and servicing schedules for vehicles.
	Provide customer service support by addressing inquiries related to trips and deliveries.
	Prepare and submit daily/weekly reports on transport operations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree, HND / OND qualifications with 3 - 4 years of relevant work experience.
	Candidate must reside in Maza-Maza or it's environs.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Automobile Fleet Maintenance Supervisor

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra 
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Responsibilities 


	Supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, technicians, and support staff in the automobile maintenance workshop.
	Plan, schedule, and monitor preventive and corrective maintenance of all company vehicles (buses, trucks, cars, etc.)
	Inspect vehicles to identify mechanical issues and ensure timely resolution.
	Ensure all maintenance and repair activities comply with safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate records of vehicle maintenance history, repairs, and spare parts usage.
	Monitor workshop inventory, requisition spare parts, and ensure proper usage to minimize wastage.
	Prepare periodic reports on fleet condition, maintenance costs, and downtime.
	Train and guide mechanics/technicians to improve skill levels and efficiency.
	Collaborate with fleet operations to minimize vehicle downtime and ensure availability for business needs.
	Enforce compliance with company policies, health, and safety guidelines in the workshop.
	Recommend improvements in maintenance processes and cost-control measures.


Requirements


	Candidates must reside at Onitsha or its environs.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / month

Click here to apply online
